ENG: There Are More Than Four Perpetrators?

TextJPN: 「自分で喉を掻き破った出血性ショック死。@k@vS20/00/443200002.爪の間に皮膚片が残っておった。間違いなく本人のものじゃわい。@k@vS20/00/443200003.傷の形も一致する」
TextENG: ``Hypovolemic shock induced by clawing out their own throat.@k@vS20/00/443200002. Tissue is packed under the nails. It's undoubtedly by the individual's own nails.@k@vS20/00/443200003. The shape of the scars also matches.``

TextJPN: 「えぇえぇ。直接死因が自殺ってのはわかってますよ」
TextENG: ``Yeaaaah... I know the immediate cause of death was suicide.``

TextJPN: 「わかっとるわい。人為的にこういう症状が起こせんかと言っとるんだろう？」
TextENG: ``I get it. You're saying the cause of death is unnatural, right?``

TextJPN: 「背中が痒くて掻きすぎて、血が出ちゃうのとはちょっと訳がちがいますからねぇ」
TextENG: ``It's not quite on the same level as when your back itches and you scratch a little too hard and draw blood, after all.``

TextJPN: 富竹氏の指には爪が剥がれたものもある。
TextENG: Some of Tomitake's fingernails had been pulled out.

TextJPN: 爪自体は割と簡単に剥がれる。
TextENG: Fingernails actually rip off surprisingly easily.

TextJPN: だがとても痛い。
TextENG: But it really hurts.

TextJPN: だから普通は剥がれるような無茶はしない。
TextENG: Under normal circumstances, the pain would prevent you from completely pulling them out.

TextJPN: そして、富竹氏の遺体に残る数々のアザ。
TextENG: Also, there were a lot of bruises on Tomitake's body.

TextJPN: …形状その他から素手の暴行によるもの、それも複数人に囲まれてであることは明白だ。
TextENG: ...It's clear from the shape of them that he was assaulted first by someone—or a group of people.

TextJPN: 「分泌物から見て、仏は極度の興奮状態にあったのは間違いないのう」
TextENG: ``According to the toxicology report, the deceased was in an extreme state of hysteria right before death.``

TextJPN: 「では乱闘になって、興奮のあまり自分の喉を引っ掻きだしたってことですか？　襲った連中、さぞや度肝を抜かれたでしょうなぁ」
TextENG: ``Then he fought back and clawed out his own throat because of how hysterical he had become? The guys attacking him certainly would have been surprised by that.``

TextJPN: 確かに異常な環境で異常に興奮した人間は、健常者には考えられない行動を取ることはありえる。
TextENG: It is possible that, in such an abnormal environment, a person could perform acts that a sane individual couldn't possibly imagine.

TextJPN: 無論、極めて稀有なケースだが。
TextENG: Of course, those are very rare cases.

TextJPN: 「実はな、大石。仏が武器にしたらしい角材な。@k@vS20/00/443200007.砂粒とかガードレールの塗装片とかそんなのしか出んかったぞい」
TextENG: ``Actually, Ooishi-kun, that wood plank the deceased used as a weapon?@k@vS20/00/443200007. They only found sand and the paint from the guardrail on it.``

TextJPN: 「ホシの服の繊維とか、皮膚片とかは？」
TextENG: ``What about cloth fibers or skin?``

TextJPN: 「出んかった。仏は犯人を殴っとらん。@k@vS20/00/443200009.…あるいは殴った角材を、ホシが持ち去ったのかも知れんの」
TextENG: ``Nothing. The deceased didn't strike the assailants...@k@vS20/00/443200009. Or it could be they took the plank he was fighting back with.``

TextJPN: 「なら、わざわざ角材なんて置いていきませんよ。全部持ってっちゃいます」
TextENG: ``In that case, they wouldn't have gone out of their way to replace it with another. They'd take them all.``

TextJPN: 「かっかっかっか！　それもそうじゃのう」
TextENG: ``Har har har har! That's true.``

TextJPN: 「富竹氏は結構、体格もいいし肌も焼けてるし。…スポーツマンですよねぇ」
TextENG: ``Tomitake's pretty built and tanned... He was quite athletic.``

TextJPN: 「ん？　そうだな。@k@vS20/00/443200012.よく運動しとるようだの」
TextENG: ``Hm? That's right.@k@vS20/00/443200012. He was pretty active.``

TextJPN: …生前に何のスポーツを嗜んでいたか想像はつかないが、身体能力は高い方だと思う。
TextENG: ...I can't imagine what kind of sports he did when he was alive, but I think his physical strength would be on the higher side.

TextJPN: つまり、乱闘では決してひけを取らないはずなのだ。
TextENG: Meaning, he would be difficult to overpower in a brawl.

TextJPN: これだけ体格のいい男が、身に危険が迫って、死に物狂いで武器を振り回して。
TextENG: If a man with such a physique sensed he was in danger and swung the plank around frantically...

TextJPN: それが犯人にかすりもしないなんて、ちょっと普通では考えられない。
TextENG: It's just unthinkable that it wouldn't even nick the perpetrator.

TextJPN: しかも相手は素手。
TextENG: And his opponent was unarmed.

TextJPN: こっちは角材なんだから、１回くらいは殴れたと思うのだが…。
TextENG: This guy had a wooden plank, so you'd think he'd hit them at least once...

TextJPN: 「こんだけ体格のいい相手を取り囲んで襲おうとしたら、…何人くらいいりますかねぇ」
TextENG: ``To surround and take down someone of his physique... I wonder how many people it would take.``

TextJPN: 「あほぅ。それは大石の方が得意だろうが。@k@vS20/00/443200014.悪タレ時代を思い出さんかい！」
TextENG: ``Ya dimwit... If anything, that's your specialty.@k@vS20/00/443200014. Have you forgotten your 'Bad Cop' days?``

TextJPN: 私が彼と喧嘩するなら何人ほしい？
TextENG: If I was to take down this guy, how many would I need?

TextJPN: 群が時に大型獣を倒すように、多人数で襲うのは狩りの鉄則だ。
TextENG: When a group wants to take down big prey it's fundamental to attack with numbers.

TextJPN: ……４人くらいはほしい。
TextENG: ...I'd guess about four.

TextJPN: 多少の体格差があってもこれだけいればなんとかなる。
TextENG: Even if there was a gap in their strength, they'd manage.

TextJPN: 「だとすると、結構犯人は多人数だの。@k@vS20/00/443200016.祭りで泥酔した４人以上のグループが怪しいとなるかの？」
TextENG: ``Then there were quite a few perpetrators.@k@vS20/00/443200016. So any drunk-and-disorderly groups of more than four are suspicious?``

TextJPN: ………４人以上のグループ。
TextENG: ...A group of four or more.

TextJPN: しかし…それだけの人数がいれば、遺体をもっと目に付きにくいところに隠せなかっただろうか？
TextENG: Just... if they had that many, then couldn't they have hidden the body in a less obvious location?

TextJPN: あるいは…瀕死の状態で監禁されていたのをなんとか抜け出してきたのか…。
TextENG: Or... did he somehow break away from that fatal predicament...

TextJPN: だとしたら自殺する理由がわからない。
TextENG: Then there would be no reason to commit suicide.

TextJPN: それ以上に、あの異常な死に方の理由がわからない……。@k謎だらけだ。
TextENG: Moreover, I still can't comprehend the irregular way he died...@k It's full of mysteries.

TextJPN: 「こっちもそこは重視しとる。徹底的に調べるつもりだが…あまり期待できんな。@k@vS20/00/443200018.何しろ、過去にこんな例はないんだからな」
TextENG: ``That's under serious consideration on my end, too. I'll be examining it as thoroughly as possible, but don't get your hopes up.@k@vS20/00/443200018. After all, we've never encountered a death like this before.``

TextJPN: 「期待はしませんよ。ですが結果を楽しみにしてます」
TextENG: ``I'm not hoping for much. But I am looking forward to the results.``

TextJPN: 「大石さん～！　課長が呼んでるっすー！」
TextENG: ``Ooishi-san~! The chief is calling you!``

TextJPN: 「すみません、ではまた来年お会いしましょう」
TextENG: ``Thanks. See ya 'round.``

TextJPN: 「おう。いいお年をの！」
TextENG: ``Yeah. Best wishes!``
